title: Strange version appears when downloading TB to new laptop
content:
I've just downloaded TB to my new laptop and it has loaded version 128.6.0esr (64-bit) with About showing 3 extra notes:- Nebular icon, Thunderbird is up to date and 'You are currently on an esr update channel'. The layout looks way too much like Outlook for my liking so I checked my out laptop and About shows it to be 115.18.0 (32-bit) with Supernova icon, Thunderbird is up to date and the same 'You are currently on an esr update channel'. So, how do I get TB on the new laptop (currently showing 128.6.0esr (64 bit) to be, or at least have the same layout as, my old one showing 115.18.0 (32 bit) that I know and love? Thanks Chris

p.s. I can take screenshots of both layouts if necessary but if I can get to the same version first that might solve the issue.
creator: chris119

title: How to undo threading of emails
content:
I am using Thunderbird on a Windows 10 PC with RCN internet. I had to create a new "account" when an old one wouldn't work since a recent Thunderbird ungrade ( :/ ) and now this new one keeps threading emails, which I hate and want back to individual ones.

Is this possible?

Thank you.
creator: murphy.lauri.a

title: Hacked Email
content: My Email has been hacked - I have contacted Telstra reset my password I am now able to receive emails but cannot send them Can you help?
creator: fp4vsv85s7

title: Mozilla  donated
content: After installation, continually asked for my name, e-mail address, Also continually asked for a donation which I have done through PayPal. In any case, the program never gets any further and, the (word, ALLOW) never can be found. Any help will be appreciated.
creator: jimking46

title: Thunderbird email reply displays are unreadable body text
content:
Some emails I receive, when I reply to them, don't correctly display the email (body text) correctly. It looks like Thunderbird is choosing the wrong font colour for the reply email text and I'm after any info on why this happens and how to fix it.

Attached are two screen shots. "original.jpg" shows the original email and "reply.jpg" is my reply email. It doesn't always happen and it *may* be emails sent out by Zendesk.

I'm on latest TBird 128.6.0esr but it's been happening for the last few releases.
creator: webby2019
